segments.content: Karma leads to substantial efficiency gains, and these gains benefit almost all participants. Only non-adopters, that is, individuals who do not participate in karma bidding actively themselves, do not benefit.

Efficiency went up in all treatments. In all treatments, more than 90% of the population is better off with karma than under random allocation. The most favorable combination is high stake with binary bidding.

Karma is more efficient than a random allocation, according to the study. The most favorable treatment combination was that of high stake urgency process under binary bidding scheme. Participants with high urgency spread achieve higher rewards than those with low urgency spread.
